New Trade Union Inaugurated in S. Korea
Asian Regional Seminar on Juche Idea Held in India
articles.content:
New Trade Union Inaugurated in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, April 18 (KCNA) -- The Government Employees' Union of south Korea was inaugurated in Seoul on April 12, according to the south Korean KBS.
 The inaugural declaration read out at the inaugural ceremony held on the same day said that the organization would conduct activities for the rights of government employees including the elimination of the discriminations in the matters of level of their positions and types of their occupation and restructuring.

articles.title: Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy in Guinea
Foreign Figures Issue Statements on Day of Sun
articles.content:
Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy in Guinea 
    Pyongyang, April 18 (KCNA) -- Guinean President Lansana Conte sent a floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Guinea on April 13 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
 It was placed before a full-length portrait of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il by the adviser of the Presidency for the personnel affairs.
 That day, a delegation of the Party for Unity and Progress of Guinea headed by General Secretary Sekou Konate visited the DPRK embassy on the occasion of the Day of the Sun and the 13th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.

articles.title: Performance Given by State Symphony Orchestra for Festival Participants
Experience Swapped among Foreign Juche Idea Study Delegations
articles.content:
Performance Given by State Symphony Orchestra for Festival Participants 
    Pyongyang, April 18 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 24th April Spring Friendship Art Festival appreciated a performance given by the State Symphony Orchestra at the rebuilt Moranbong Theater on April 17.
 The orchestra put on the stage movement No. 4 "Glory to the General" of the symphony suite "Long Journey for Songun Leadership", the orchestral music "Rich Harvest Comes to the Chongsan Plain", "Arirang", "A Girl on a Swing" and other famous musical pieces.
 The audiences were deeply moved by the fascinating presentation of foreign repertoires including movement No.1 of Shostakovichï¿½fs 7th symphony "Leningrad".
 Foreign artistes presented bouquets to the artistes of the orchestra, congratulating them on their successful performance.

articles.title: Joint Friendly Gathering of Delegations of Juche Idea Study Groups
articles.content:
Experience Swapped among Foreign Juche Idea Study Delegations 
     Pyongyang, April 18 (KCNA) -- Delegations of Juche idea study organizations from different countries met at the People's Palace of Culture here on Monday to exchange experience.
 Present at the meeting were a delegation of the Russian Youth Association for the Study of the Songun Policy, a delegation of the Mongolian Mt. Paektu Association for Independent Development, a delegation of the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, a Japanese delegation for commemorating the Day of the Sun, a Norwegian delegation for the study of the Juche idea, and a Spanish delegate for the study of the Juche idea.    
 Members of the Korean Social Scientists Society were on hand.
 The participants exchanged achievements and experience they had gained in their activities to study and disseminate the Juche idea in past years and called for intensifying these activities.

articles.title: Cambodian King Pays Courtesy Call on Kim Yong Nam
Cambodian King Feted
articles.content:
Cambodian King Pays Courtesy Call on Kim Yong Nam
    Pyongyang, April 18 (KCNA) -- Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni paid a courtesy call on Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, at the People's Palace of Culture on April 17.
 He was accompanied by his suite members and Cambodian Ambassador to the DPRK Chhorn Hay.
 Present there were Vice-Premier of the Cabinet Ro Tu Chol, Minister of Culture Kim Jin Song, Vice-Foreign Minister Kim Yong Il, DPRK Ambassador to Cambodia Choe Han Chun and Vice-Chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee Kim Jae Gon.

articles.title: Anti-U.S. Rally in S. Korea
Japanese Government Urged to Unconditionally Extradite Criminals
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. Rally in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, April 18 (KCNA) -- The 79th Anti-U.S. Rally was reportedly held in the city of Phyongthaek, Kyonggi Province of south Korea, on April 11.
 Attending it were residents and members of such civic and public organizations as the All-People Measure Committee for Checking the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base in Phyongthaek, the Phaengsong Town Measure Committee against the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base, the Anti-U.S. Youth Society, and the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification.    
 Speakers at the rally stated that all the people would get united to do farming in Phyongthaek this year, too, against the land expropriation of the Defence Ministry and check the expansion of the U.S. military base without fail.
 A resolution was read out at the rally. It recalled that on April 7 the ministry cut off waterway to paddy and non-paddy fields designated for the expansion of the U.S. military base and destroyed farm land and instigated the public security authorities to whisk away a large number of residents struggling in defence of Phyongthaek.
 The moves of the U.S. and its followers to expand the military base are an unjustifiable act of wrecking the existence of residents and peace of the Korean Peninsula, and the people's struggle for defence of Phyongthaek is a righteous and just act for safeguarding lives and peace, the resolution said.    
 The ministry should stop at once the land expropriation moves, though belatedly, and the public security authorities should apologize to the people for their unilateral violence and promptly set free the arrested members of human rights and civic organizations, it urged.

articles.title: Russian Artistes Perform for Guests of Honor
articles.content:
Japanese Government Urged to Unconditionally Extradite Criminals
    Pyongyang, April 18 (KCNA) --The Japanese right-wing forces are very busy with their moves to build legal and institutional mechanisms to apply sanctions against the DPRK, persistently pulling up it over the "issue of abduction".
 Rodong Sinmun today observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
 The Japanese reactionaries are rattling the nerves of the DPRK by crying out for increasing pressure upon it over the "issue of abduction," pursuant to the U.S. hostile policy towards it. This is prompted by Japan's invariable intention to isolate and suffocate the DPRK at any cost.    
 If the Japanese ultra-right conservatives persist in their anti-DPRK campaign over the "abduction issue" as now, keen to toe the U.S. line, the situation will go beyond control.
 The DPRK would like to re-clarify that what Japan should do before anything else today is to redress such crimes as the abduction of Koreans and forcible drafting of them perpetrated by the Japanese imperialists in the past and settle the issue of DPRK citizens abducted by Japan in recent years. The Japanese government should not persistently raise the "abduction issue" which had already found a solution but take prompt measures for unconditionally extraditing those criminals to whom warrants for arrest were issued by the DPRK and preventing the recurrence of similar cases.

articles.title: Greetings to Tenth Congress of CPV
Chinese Women's Delegation Here
articles.content:
Greetings to Tenth Congress of CPV
    Pyongyang, April 18 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent a message of greetings to the 10th Congress of the Communist Party of Vietnam on Apr. 18.
 The message expressed the belief that the congress would serve as an important occasion in boosting the leadership ability of the party and in bringing into play the patriotism and the spirit of unity of the whole party and the army and all the people to build prosperous socialist Vietnam.    
 Expressing the conviction that the ties of friendship and cooperation between the two parties and the two peoples would grow stronger in conformity with their common desire, the message wished the congress success in its work.

articles.title: Successful Stands of Flower Festival
articles.content:
Chinese Women's Delegation Here
    Pyongyang, April 18 (KCNA) -- A Chinese women's delegation headed by Gu Xiulian, vice-chairperson of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress of China and president of the All-China Women's Federation, arrived here on Tuesday.
  It was met at the airport by Pak Sun Hui, chairperson of the Central Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union, officials concerned, Wu Donghe, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the embassy.
